discourse_list.title: U.S. Dept. of Labor Throws Cold Water on Crypto Related Retirement Investment Options

content.content: As I was doing some reading I noticed the  U.S. Department of Labor (“DOL”) curiously cautioned employers that offer 401(k) plans with cryptocurrency investment options and other similarly situated digital assets, to be extremely careful. See Compliance Assistance Release No. 2022-01 | U.S. Department of Labor (dol.gov) It seems the DOL has become aware of financial services companies marketing crypto investments as retirement-plan options recently and “has serious concerns.” DOL said crypto investments present “significant risks and challenges” to 401(k) investors, including fraud, theft, and financial loss. Without getting into the sum and substance of each aspect (which can be found in the DOL release), DOL cites to the following reasons as to support its position:  speculative and volatile investments; 2) the challenge for plan participants to make informed investment decisions; 3) custodial and recordkeeping concerns; 4) valuation concerns; and 5) an evolving regulatory environment  We shall see how it all plays out.
In the U.S., check out self directed IRA/401ks. They take a little to setup and have some funding conditions but work really well. And, you can hold your own keys.
